info.title: CMS Public API
info.description:
CMS Public API

A read-only API for serving published content to frontend applications.

Features:
- Published articles with pagination and search
- Category listings and tree structure
- Organization/ward information
- Redis caching for performance

get.description:
Get organization/ward information.

Returns basic organization details including contact information.

List published articles with pagination.

Supports filtering by category and tag.
Get latest published articles.

schema.title: Response Get Latest Articles Api V1  Org Code  Articles Latest Get

get.description: Get most viewed articles.

schema.title: Response Get Popular Articles Api V1  Org Code  Articles Popular Get

get.description:
Full-text search articles.

Searches in article title and content.

Get featured/pinned articles.

Returns articles marked as featured, typically for homepage display.

schema.title: Response Get Featured Articles Api V1  Org Code  Articles Featured Get

get.description:
Get related articles for a given article.

Returns articles in the same category or with similar tags.

schema.title: Response Get Related Articles Api V1  Org Code  Articles  Slug  Related Get

get.description:
Get article detail by slug.

Increments view count on each request.
List all active categories for organization as nested tree.

Get category tree structure.

Returns hierarchical tree with nested children.
Use depth parameter to limit tree depth (e.g. depth=1 for departments only).
Get category detail by slug.

Get articles in a specific category.

Supports pagination.

List banners for organization.

Optionally filter by position.

Get currently active banners (within date range).

Returns only banners that are currently within their display period.

schema.title: Response Get Active Banners Api V1  Org Code  Banners Active Get

get.description:
Get banner by code string.

Useful for embedding banners by their generated code.

List external links for organization.

Optionally filter by category.
Get links by category.

schema.title: Response Get Links By Category Api V1  Org Code  Links Category  Category  Get

get.description:
List all tags with article counts.

Returns tags sorted by article count (most used first).
Get articles with a specific tag.

List all static pages for the organization.

Returns pages like About Us, Contact, Privacy Policy, etc.

Get static page detail by slug.

Returns the full page content.
Get document section tree for the organization.
Get section detail with documents and data sheets by slug.
Get data sheet detail by slug.
Get document detail by slug.

Global search across articles and categories.

Searches article titles, content, and category names.
Returns matching articles (paginated) and matching categories.
Get approved comments for an article by slug.

post.description: Create a comment on an article (rate limited: 5/min per IP).
Add reaction to a comment (rate limited: 10/min per IP).

get.description: List active forms for this organization.
Get a form by slug.

post.description: Submit a form response (rate limited: 3/min per IP).

get.description:
Get all data needed for homepage in a single request.

This endpoint aggregates:
- Organization info
- Featured articles
- Latest articles
- Popular articles
- Articles by main categories
- Homepage banners
- Header/footer menus

Using this endpoint instead of multiple separate calls
significantly improves page load performance.

Get all data needed for a category page.

Includes:
- Category information
- Paginated articles in category
- Subcategories
- Parent category (for breadcrumb)

Get archive data with article counts by year/month.

Optionally filter articles by specific year/month.

Get sitemap data for SEO.

Returns all article slugs and category slugs for sitemap generation.

Get content statistics for the organization.

Returns aggregate counts of articles, categories, tags, banners, and links.
Useful for dashboard displays and overview pages.

post.description:
Copy article images to public bucket and return rewritten content.

Called by CMS backend during article publish flow.

get.description: Health check endpoint.
Root endpoint with API information.

ArchiveMonthStats.title: ArchiveMonthStats
ArchiveMonthStats.description: Article count for a specific month.

ArticleDetailResponse.title: ArticleDetailResponse
ArticleDetailResponse.description: Article detail response with full content.

CategoryArticlesSection.title: CategoryArticlesSection
CategoryArticlesSection.description: Articles grouped by category for homepage.

CategoryPageResponse.title: CategoryPageResponse
CategoryPageResponse.description:
All data needed for a category page.

Includes category info, articles, and subcategories.

DataSheetDetailResponse.title: DataSheetDetailResponse
DataSheetDetailResponse.description: Full data sheet detail with custom fields.

DataSheetSummaryResponse.description: Data sheet summary for list views.

DocSectionDetailResponse.title: DocSectionDetailResponse
DocSectionDetailResponse.description: Section detail with documents, data sheets, and breadcrumb.

DocumentSummaryResponse.title: DocumentSummaryResponse
DocumentSummaryResponse.description: Document summary (no content) for list views.

total_results.title: Total Results
total_results.description: Total matching items across all types

GlobalSearchResponse.title: GlobalSearchResponse
GlobalSearchResponse.description: Global search response with results from multiple content types.

featured_articles.title: Featured Articles
featured_articles.description: Featured/pinned articles for main highlight section

HomepageResponse.title: HomepageResponse
HomepageResponse.description:
All data needed for homepage in a single response.

Optimized to reduce multiple API calls to one.

PageSummaryResponse.title: PageSummaryResponse
PageSummaryResponse.description: Page summary (no content) for list views.

PublishAssetsRequest.title: PublishAssetsRequest
PublishAssetsRequest.description: Request body for publishing article assets.

latest_article_date.title: Latest Article Date
latest_article_date.description: Date of the most recent article
